thread.title: UK Govt Has Statutory Responsibility To Consider Whether GKN-Melrose Merger Gives Rise To Public Interest Concerns - Business Secretary‍​

author: Reuters Editorial
title: UK Govt Has Statutory Responsibility To Consider Whether GKN-Melrose Merger Gives Rise To Public Interest Concerns - Business Secretary‍​
text:
March 29 (Reuters) - UK Business Secretary Greg Clark:
* “DURING BID, MELROSE MADE COMMITMENTS WHICH THEY ARE BOUND TO HONOUR INCLUDING INVESTMENT IN RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, MAINTAINING ITSELF AS UK BUSINESS” ‍​
* GOVERNMENT HAS STATUTORY RESPONSIBILITY TO CONSIDER WHETHER GKN-MELROSE MERGER IN PROPOSED FINAL FORM GIVES RISE TO PUBLIC INTEREST CONCERNS
* ASSESSMENT ON WHETHER MERGER GIVES RISE TO PUBLIC INTEREST CONCERNS WILL BE MADE BY APPROPRIATE AUTHORITIES
* CONCLUSION ON ASSESSMENT ON WHETHER MERGER GIVES RISE TO PUBLIC INTEREST CONCERNS WILL BE SET OUT IN DUE COURSE Further company coverage:
